trends: There has been one other sighting in Chicopee
There were no other sightings in Chicopee on or around November 30th 1995
divs: Sighting DetailsJust a character note Im a manager and a Pilot, and was Finance Officer andPilot for the Westover ARB Civil Air Patrol squadron.Before going to bed, I had brought my dog downstairs to the backyard to let herdo her thing.While standing in the doorway waiting for her to finish, I felt compelled tolook up into a certain section of the sky which was almost directly above myhead.After only looking at the sky for a few seconds, I saw what appeared to be ameteor going from the south to the north.The distance it covered was approximately the distance of a ruler held at armslength.This did not seem out of the ordinary until about 2 seconds later when anothermeteor-like object or the same one, Im not sure followed the EXACT oppositetrack of the first.That is, where the first started and disappeared, the second appeared and thendisappeared covering the same distance as the first.To this day, I am convinced that this, or these, objects were not meteorsbecause of the extremely high improbability of two meteors mirroring theirtracks and distance in such a short timeframe. It being one meteor is out of thequestion, since a meteor cant go in reverse.Thanks for your time,Mike
Summary: Worlds first reversing meteor, I dont think so.
